intro: Cardenanthus boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian poppy, is a striking flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes many species of poppies, and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in rocky soils and mountainous regions. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
